fullText: At times, the psychological slow burn of his new dark comedy moves at a snail’s pace — lethargizing the play’s momentum and stretching entire scenes beyond comprehension — but “Grey House” cracks open in its final moments. And by its end, the play accomplishes what only the best of its genre is able to: It reminds us that the scariest monster of all lives in mankind.
